scientific.overview: Your aloe vera plant appears healthy. Maintain current care practices to ensure continued vitality.

steps.title: Continue current watering schedule
steps.details: Water when top 2-3 inches of soil are dry. Typically every 2-3 weeks, adjusting for season and humidity.

steps.title: Provide adequate light
steps.details: Ensure 6-8 hours of bright, indirect light daily. Some morning direct sun is beneficial.

steps.title: Fertilize during growing season
steps.details: Apply balanced liquid fertilizer (10-10-10) at half strength monthly from March to September.

steps.title: Monitor for pests and diseases
steps.details: Perform weekly visual inspection of leaves and base for any changes in color, texture, or pests.

scientific.dosage_frequency: Fertilizer: Half-strength liquid fertilizer monthly during growing season only.
safety_warnings: Do not overwater - most aloe problems stem from excess water
Avoid cold drafts and temperatures below 50°F (10°C)
Do not over-fertilize - succulents need minimal feeding
when_to_consult_expert: Any sudden changes in plant appearance
Planning to use aloe gel medicinally

citations.title: Optimal Growing Conditions for Aloe Vera
citations.snippet: Aloe vera thrives with minimal intervention when basic needs are met: well-draining soil, infrequent watering, and bright indirect light.

ayurvedic.overview: Your plant exhibits balanced Tridosha. Continue nurturing its Prana (life force) through mindful care.

steps.title: Maintain Sattvic watering practice
steps.details: Water with intention during morning hours. Speak positive affirmations to the plant while watering to enhance its Prana.

steps.title: Provide balanced solar energy
steps.details: Ensure plant receives Surya (sun) energy in morning, with protection during harsh afternoon heat. East-facing placement is ideal per Vastu.

steps.title: Monthly Panchagavya feeding
steps.details: Apply diluted Panchagavya (1:20 ratio) to soil to enhance plant immunity and Ojas (vitality).

steps.title: Maintain clean environment
steps.details: Gently wipe leaves with damp cloth to remove dust. This clears Srotas (channels) for better energy flow.

ayurvedic.dosage_frequency: Panchagavya: 1:20 dilution monthly. Water: When soil is dry, following lunar cycle awareness.
safety_warnings: Avoid watering during full moon - may cause excess Kapha
Use only pure, filtered water - tap water chemicals may disturb dosha balance

Guidance on dosha-specific plant care rituals
Interest in propagation timing per astrological considerations
